Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The player object represents the two players of the game. Manages turns, and playing cards onto the board's node array. Players can have a seperate cardpool to build hands from. Players need to know if it's their turn to make a play. Player's need to know where their hand is to validate if a correct click was made when attempting to play a card.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Keagen Thomson

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(java.lang.String owner,
              HiddenCardPool deck,
              Hand hand,
              int boardLocation)
        Creates player object taking the folllowing parameters
        Parameters:
        owner - The player's name which is a string that should be "Player 1" or "Player 2"
        deck - The cardpool a player can build their hand from
        hand - The hand used in the game that contains cards
        boardLocation - the index column the player's hand is at.
        cardsInHand - the total of all cards in this player's hand, used when calculating

      • Player

        public Player​(java.lang.String owner)
        2nd Constructor if a player is ever generated which it IS in the standard case

    • Method Detail

      • updateCardsInHand

        public void updateCardsInHand()
        Update's the player's cards in hand with the hand collections size method.

      • getCardsInHand

        public int getCardsInHand()
        Getter for cards in hand which is updated for sanity's sake after every play. Used in score calculations.

      • getOwner

        public java.lang.String getOwner()
        Getter for player's name or "owner" which is either "Player 1" or "Player 2" as generated by the controller class. It is open to modify, in the event functionality beyond pregenerated hands and matches are possible i.e. IRL players can build a deck and name their character

      • getHand

        public Hand getHand()
        Returns:
        The player's hand containing all the cards they can make a play with

      • setHand

        public void setHand​(Hand hand)
        Setter for player's hand

      • getBoardLocation

        public int getBoardLocation()
        Getter for the player's hand
        Returns:
        Returns the player's hand location on the Board which is used for drawing to the screen

      • setBoardLocation

        public void setBoardLocation​(int columnIndex)
        Setter for player's board location an index location on the board based on the player's turn order. Players that go First are on the right side of the board (Index column 4) while players that go 2nd are on the left side of the board (Index column 0).

      • getDeck

        public HiddenCardPool getDeck()
        Getter for player's deck used to "deal" cards to the player's hand

      • setDeck

        public void setDeck​(HiddenCardPool deck)
        Setter for player's deck if in the future it is possible to build a deck that isn't randomly generated

      • getTurn

        public java.lang.Boolean getTurn()
        Getter for the turn, used when toggling active player

      • setTurn

        public void setTurn​(java.lang.Boolean turn)
        Getter for a player's turn

      • toggleTurn

        public void toggleTurn()
        Toggles a player's turn Property used to determine active player when calculating valid clickState for player's hand.

      • playCard

        public boolean playCard​(int handCardIndex,
                        int boardIndex,
                        Board board)
        plays a card to the board if and only if the index was empty then it updates the hand with the play and sends the boolean status of the method call to its caller
        Parameters:
        handCardIndex - the index of a card to be played from the hand
        boardIndex - the board index a card is to be played on
        board - the board that is being played on. Usually only one, this is called by the model and passes its board to this method
        Returns:
        if a card was removed from the hand and played on the board

      • attemptPlayCard

        public boolean attemptPlayCard​(int boardIndex,
                               Board board)
        Method for the player to check if a play is valid before removing the card from their hand
        Parameters:
        boardIndex - the board index to test if there's a card at
        board - the board to test, passed in by the model's attemptPlay method

      • buildPlayer

        public void buildPlayer()
        Wrapper method for simpler construction of a player's deck and hand
